def_cn: (使)咔嚓一声折断;(使)啪的一声绷断
def_en: If something snaps or if you snap it, it breaks suddenly, usually with a sharp cracking noise.

def_cn: (使)发出吧嗒一声(合上或打开)
def_en: If you snap something into a particular position, or if it snaps into that position, it moves quickly into that position, with a sharp sound.

def_cn: (打拍子、下指示等时)打响指
def_en: If you snap your fingers, you make a sharp sound by moving your middle finger quickly across your thumb, for example in order to accompany music or to order someone to do something.

def_cn: 恶声恶气地说;声色俱厉地说
def_en: If someone snaps at you, they speak to you in a sharp, unfriendly way.

def_cn: 突然精神崩溃;突然失控
def_en: If someone snaps, or if something snaps inside them, they suddenly stop being calm and become very angry because the situation has become too tense or too difficult for them.
If an animal such as a dog snaps at you, it opens and shuts its jaws quickly near you, as if it were going to bite you.

def_cn: (决定、行动等)突然的，仓促的，鲁莽的
def_en: A snap decision or action is one that is taken suddenly, often without careful thought.
If you snap someone or something, you take a photograph of them.

def_cn: “捉对儿”(一种简单的扑克牌游戏，参加者轮流亮牌叠成一叠，争取在出现同点数或同人头的两张牌时，先喊snap以赢得整叠牌)
def_en: Snap is a simple British card game in which the players take turns to put cards down on a pile, and try to be the first to shout 'snap' when two cards with the same number or picture are put down.

def_cn: “哟！”(对两件物品相似之极发出的惊叹)
def_en: You can say 'Snap!' as an expression of surprise when you realize that two things are the same or very similar, for example if you meet a friend wearing the same shirt as you.
A snap is the same as a snap fastener .
cold snap;
